void opmMessage ( const char *  severity,
const char *  ident,
const char *  fmt,
  ... 
)

Send formatted text to the simulator output stream. The text is prefixed with the severity, the prefix code and the model instance name. Use this for user-level diagnostics.

Parameters:
severity I=Info, W=Warning, E=Error, F=Fatal (aborts the simulator).
ident A short code to identify this message. This makes the message easy to extract using text tools.
fmt Printf format string (see gnu printf for details).
... This is a vararg function.
void void opmMessageDirect ( optTextOutputFn  outputcb,
optQuitFn  quitcb,
void *  userData 
)

Direct all text output from the simulator to these callbacks.

Parameters:
outputcb The text output function.
quitcb Function called before simulator exits (use this to flush your text).
userData Pass this in the userData argument.
void opmMessageDisable ( const char *  ident  ) 

Turn off messages with an ident beginning with the passed string.

Parameters:
ident The start of the ident to be turned off. e.g. OP_ turns off messages beginning OP_.
Bool opmMessageQuiet ( void   ) 

Use this to respond to the simulator -verbose flag.

Returns:
True if platform should be verbose.
Bool opmMessageSetNoWarn ( Bool  quiet  ) 

Suppress warning messages.

Returns:
The old value.
Parameters:
quiet No warnings.
Bool opmMessageSetQuiet ( Bool  quiet  )

Returns:
The old value.

Are we in global verbose mode.

Returns:
True if verbose.
Bool opmNoBanner ( void   ) 

Return the state of the --nobanner flag.

Returns:
